text.text_translated: Researchers are asking if special **genes**, which are parts of our DNA that control how we grow, gave people the ability to speak. They have found a change in a gene that happened between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago. This change seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Although monkeys have a similar gene, it did not have this same change. It is still too early to say how much genes affect language, but the answers might one day be found in our DNA.
